The 18 Best Clean Perfumes Worth Adding to Your Rotation From bright floral scents to earthy, woody notes. Read the back of any bottle in your medicine cabinet, and we're betting you'll find the catch-all term "fragrance" listed as one of the first ingredients—with the exception of some of the best clean perfumes. As companies have no legal obligation to disclose the exact combination of components included in their products (often considered proprietary information), it's easy for manufacturers to sneak in a number of undesirable—and potentially harmful—ingredients under the umbrella term. "Fragrance transparency is growing, and consumers are eager to know the stories behind the materials that make their fragrances unique," [Donna Ramanauskas](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dramanauskas/), senior perfumer fragrance- functional-based ingredients listed by the [International Fragrance Association (IFRA)](https://ifrafragrance.org/priorities/ingredients/ifra-transparency-list) as of 2022, typical perfume and cologne mixtures can feature up to several hundred different chemicals, many of them synthetic. And, according to a [2018 study](https://www.noaa.gov/news/those-scented-products-you-love-noaa-study-finds-they-can-cause-air-pollution), these formulas can also emit the same amount of chemical vapors as petroleum emissions from cars. The vapors—also known as [volatile organic compounds](https://www.epa.gov/indoor-air-quality-iaq/volatile-organic-compounds-impact-indoor-air-quality) or VOCs—react with proteins in our body, which can result in physical immune responses like breathing issues, migraines, [hormone disruption](https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=74968X1525079&url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.springer.com%2Farticle%2F10.1007%2Fs11869-016-0442-z), skin irritation, and more, even potentially compounding into long-term [health effects](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5093181/). Shop Our Editors Favorite Clean Perfumes To add a bit more simplicity to your [go-to scent rotation](https://www.harpersbazaar.com/beauty/makeup/g38284762/best-perfume-for-women/) (in a good way), we've pulled together a few of the best clean fragrances editors and shoppers love. Featuring top-rated, 100 percent natural picks to [fragrance staples](https://www.harpersbazaar.com/beauty/health/g42179389/best-jo-malone-perfumes/) with ingredients you won't need a translator for, these coveted selects are making beauty safer and more enjoyable with their total formula transparency. What makes a fragrance formula clean? Quality, plant-based essential oils used as fragrance can be extremely beneficial for your skin, but they can also be irritants—and therefore considered toxic—at certain levels. How the essential oil is processed also matters. A number of beauty retailers, like [Follain](https://follain.com/collections/skincare/products/vintners-daughter-active-botanical-serum), [Credo](https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=74968X1525079&url=https%3A%2F%2Fcredobeauty.com%2F), and [Sephora](https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=SyrN4SGJMyU&mid=2417&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sephora.com%2Fshop%2Fclean-fragrance) monitor the levels and quality of essential oils in the beauty products they stock to ensure safety, but it is important for consumers to know the risks when buying direct from independent or conventional essential oil brands. How can I ensure I'm using a clean, non-toxic perfume? Take a closer look the list of ingredients used in your favorite fragrances, along with the sourcing process of any essential oils that are included in their formulas. Are the blends considered natural and organic? Are the listed ingredients farmed responsibly? It can also be helpful to cross reference primary ingredients found in perfumes with a reputable third party, like the [Environmental Working Group](https://www.ewg.org/). Two years ago, Olivia and Jenna started casually sharing links with each other about clean beauty. What started out as a hobby (from disecting the lastest research to discovering the most innovative new products) quickly became an obession. But they soon realized that the business of clean beauty was as confusing as it was compelling, thanks to a lot of confliciting data and obscure marketing jargon. To separate science from science fiction, Jenna and Olivia spoke with leading beauty experts; pored over studies and data; and swiped, swatched, and spritzed hundreds of clean hair and skincare products to get to the root of what it really means to be clean and natural in the realm of beauty.
